business.headline: 5% Ghee-ST heralds relief and big Diwali celebrationsIn a big boost to Indian households, the government is bringing down the rates of common goods by reducing the Goods and Services Tax (GST). The Modi government publicised it as a 'Historic Diwali Gift for the Nation'. Ghee, milk and other dairy products are synonymous with Indian festivals, and the relief comes amid India digging its heels on the dairy and farm sector in trade talks with the US.

GST 2.0 cuts cement costs: Will affordable housing get a push?The government's GST 2.0 reform has slashed tax on cement and steel from 28% to 18%. Developers say this could lower construction costs and revive demand in the struggling affordable housing segment. But will the benefits reach homebuyers?

Farmers get GST breather: Tractors, fruits and fertilisers turn affordableFollowing the latest GST announcement, farmers are expected to get relief as their cultivation costs will reduce. Farmers have long demanded lower taxes for the agriculture sector.

GST 2.0 completes the economic hat-trick: What it means for IndiansGST 2.0, combined with income tax relief and cheaper loans, delivers an economic hat-trick, making essentials affordable, boosting consumption, and signaling a new phase of growth and investor optimism in India

No GST on life and health insurance: Will your premiums really drop?Insurance buyers have reason to cheer as GST has been waived on life and health insurance policies. But will this move make premiums cheaper, or will the benefit be limited? Let's break it down.

Explained: Watching IPL live just got costlier thanks to new GST rulesCricket fans in India will now have to pay more to watch IPL matches live, after the government raised the GST on premium sporting events from 28% to 40%. A ticket that previously cost Rs 1,000 plus GST, bringing the total to Rs 1,280, will now set fans back Rs 1,400—a jump of Rs 120.
GST 2.0: Check list of all goods that are now tax-freeA key part of the reforms under GST 2.0 is the exemption of many essential goods and services from GST, moving them into the 0% tax category.

GST 2.0: 11 key FAQs you must knowWith new GST rates kicking in from 22 September 2025, the tax system is set for its biggest revamp in years. These 11 FAQs break down what's cheaper, what's costlier, and what it means for you.

From gyms to cycles, how GST reforms mirror PM's push for healthy IndiaThe latest GST overhaul, aligning with Prime Minister Modi's call for a fitter nation, slashes taxes on fitness, wellness services, and healthy food items to 5%.

Consumer and auto stocks in focus as GST bonanza lights up Dalal StreetThe Nirmala Sitharaman-led GST Council overhauled the complicated indirect tax regime, announcing sharp reductions in rates on food and daily essential items as well as consumer durables like TVs and refrigerators.

Not just small cars, big cars also cheaper under GST 2.0Earlier, buyers of big petrol and diesel cars paid an effective tax of nearly 50%, comprising 28% GST plus a hefty 22% compensation cess. Under the new system, this has been rationalised to a flat 40% GST.

Markets jump as GST 2.0 lifts consumer-driven stocks. What should investors do?By scrapping the earlier 12% and 28% rates, GST 2.0 promises to simplify compliance and make essentials cheaper. Market participants believe this could set the stage for a consumption revival, with direct benefits for autos, fast-moving consumer goods, cement, housing and financials.

entertainment.headline: The Return of Sonu Nigam and the voice Bollywood forgotSonu Nigam makes a powerful return to Bollywood, reviving the magic of melody that the industry has been missing for years. With 'Bijuria' and 'Pardesiya' striking gold, one thing is clear: Nigam is and will always be irreplaceable.

Coolie on OTT: When and where to watch Rajinikanth-Lokesh Kanagaraj's Tamil actionerAfter a spectacular theatrical run, Rajinikanth and Lokesh Kanagaraj's 'Coolie' is set for its OTT streaming. The Tamil film, also starring Nagarjuna, Shruti Haasan, and others, will release on Prime Video.

Will Taylor Swift perform at Super Bowl halftime? NFL commissioner respondsNFL commissioner Roger Goodell suggested Taylor Swift's Super Bowl halftime show appearance was "a maybe", heightening anticipation as fans await word from Roc Nation.

Travis Kelce on introducing Taylor Swift as fiancee to colleagues: Pretty coolTravis Kelce recently introduced Taylor Swift as his fiancee to his colleagues. He shared the moment on the 'New Heights' podcast. The player also expressed gratitude for the overwhelming love from fans.

The Paper, The Office spin-off, renewed for Season 2 ahead of September 5 premierePeacock's new sitcom 'The Paper' has been renewed for a second season even before its first episode airs. Featuring a talented cast and veteran creators, the series will begin to stream from September 5.

No objectionable content: Court rejects plea against Akshay Kumar's Jolly LLB 3The Allahabad High Court recently dismissed the plea against Akshay Kumar's 'Jolly LLB 3'. The film is slated to hit the big screens on September 19.

Bigg Boss 19 episode 10: Pranit loses captaincy access after taking dig at ZeishanPranit More's stand-up comedy act in the latest episode of 'Bigg Boss 19' irked Zeeshan Quadri and Tanya Mittal. Housemates later voted in favour of Zeishan Quadri and eliminated Pranit More from the race for captaincy.

Slow Horses 5 trailer: Gary Oldman returns as head of misfits to probe terror plotThe first trailer for actor Gary Oldman's 'Slow Horses Season 5' has been released. The new season delves into London terror plots as Oldman's Jackson Lamb leads his team of misfits.

Avatar The Way of Water to re-release in India in October ahead of Fire and AshJames Cameron's 'Avatar: The Way of Water' is set to re-release in Indian theatres from October 2, 2025, offering an immersive 3D experience ahead of the next franchise chapter, 'Avatar: Fire & Ash'.

The Bengal Files faces unofficial ban in Bengal: Pallavi Joshi writes to PresidentActor-producer Pallavi Joshi has written an open letter to President Droupadi Murmu, alleging an "unofficial ban" on Vivek Agnihotri's 'The Bengal Files' in West Bengal. Accusing the Mamata Banerjee-led TMC government of threatening theatre owners and stifling the film's release, Joshi urged the President to intervene and safeguard the constitutional right to free expression.

Netflix announces new Tamil thriller The Game, to begin streaming in OctoberNetflix is set to launch its first Tamil original of 2025, 'The Game: You Never Play Alone', a gripping thriller premiering on October 2. Directed by Rajesh M Selva and starring Shraddha Srinath and Santhosh Prathap, the series explores trust and identity in today's hyper-connected world.

KBC 17: Contestant misses Rs 12.5 lakh question on Annapurna Devi. Can you answer?Contestant Ameya Vinayak Deshpande quit 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 17' at the Rs 12.5 lakh question, which had a surprising link to Annapurna Devi. Read more to find out what the question was.

Who is Ashish Kapoor, TV actor arrested on rape charges in Delhi?Television actor Ashish Kapoor was arrested by Delhi Police following rape allegations made by a woman during a house party in the capital. The incident has sparked widespread attention as investigations continue, with the entertainment industry and fans awaiting further updates.

Shehnaaz Gill's Ikk Kudi release postponed to October due to Punjab floodsShehnaaz Gill's upcoming release 'Ikk Kudi' has been postponed to October amid Punjab floods. The movie is now slated to hit the big screens on October 31.

Vir Das becomes first Indian comic to perform at Lincoln Center in New YorkVir Das will make history as the first Indian to headline a residency at New York's Lincoln Center Theater with his show Hey 'Stranger'. It will run from October 29 to November 9, 2025.

Baaghi 4 tops Tiger Shroff's Bade Miyan, Ganapath, Heropanti 2 in advance bookingTiger Shroff's 'Baaghi 4' advance booking collections seem good at the box office. The action-packed entertainer has already crossed 'Ganapath' and 'Heropanti 2', and is on track to beat 'Bade Miyan Chote Miyan' in pre-sales.

Sophie Turner is the new Lara Croft in upcoming Tomb Raider seriesHollywood actor Sophie Turner has been cast as Lara Croft in the new 'Tomb Raider' series. The 'Game of Thrones' alum shared her excitement on social media.

Matthew Perry death case: Ketamine queen Jasveen Sangha pleads guilty'Friends' star Matthew Perry died from a ketamine overdose in October 2023. Los Angeles-based drug dealer Jasveen Sangha pleaded guilty to five charges.

Lokah box office Day 7: Kalyani's film hits Rs 100 crore, continues unstoppable runMalayalam cinema's first female superhero film, 'Lokah Chapter 1: Chandra', became the third film in the industry to cross Rs 100 crore at the box office. With overwhelming reviews, the film is continuing its unstoppable run.

general news.headline: Exclusive: Tariffs on India key to Ukraine peace, Team Trump tells US top courtThe Trump administration took the fight over tariffs to the Supreme Court, asking the justices to rule quickly that the president has the power to impose sweeping import taxes.

Months after Op Sindoor strikes, reconstruction begins at Pak's Nur Khan baseFresh satellite imagery reveals Pakistan rebuilding parts of Nur Khan airbase in Rawalpindi, months after Indian strikes destroyed specialised military trucks.

No GST on life and health insurance: Will your premiums really drop?Insurance buyers have reason to cheer as GST has been waived on life and health insurance policies. But will this move make premiums cheaper, or will the benefit be limited? Let's break it down.

Mamata Banerjee's fiery speech in Assembly, BJP chief whip injured amid uproarDuring her address in the West Bengal Assembly, Mamata Banerjee accused Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Union Home Minister Amit Shah of being "anti-Bengal" and blocking discussions on harassment of Bengalis.

Mood of the Nation: Modi must pay close attention to these 7 signals from votersIt is time for the top leadership of the NDA, particularly the Bharatiya Janata Party, to listen to the signals that voters are sending.

5% Ghee-ST heralds relief and big Diwali celebrationsIn a big boost to Indian households, the government is bringing down the rates of common goods by reducing the Goods and Services Tax (GST). The Modi government publicised it as a 'Historic Diwali Gift for the Nation'. Ghee, milk and other dairy products are synonymous with Indian festivals, and the relief comes amid India digging its heels on the dairy and farm sector in trade talks with the US.

Can't talk to India, China like that: Putin's 'colonial era' jab at TrumpPutin also stressed that Washington's rhetoric echoes outdated thinking. "The colonial era is now over. They have to realise they can't use these terms in speaking with partners," he said.

Mahanaaryaman in MPCA hot seat: How Scindias have controlled Madhya Pradesh cricketMahanaaryaman Scindia is the third in the Scindia family to hold the MPCA president's post, after father Jyotiraditya Scindia and grandfather Madhavrao Scindia

Indian restaurant owners in UK share post on diners failing to settle Rs 23,000 billRaman Kaur and Narinder Singh Athwa, who run the Sai Surbhi restaurant in Urmston, claimed that the group of four adults and four children enjoyed their meals and drinks, praised the food and service, but failed to settle the bill.

Not just small cars, big cars also cheaper under GST 2.0Earlier, buyers of big petrol and diesel cars paid an effective tax of nearly 50%, comprising 28% GST plus a hefty 22% compensation cess. Under the new system, this has been rationalised to a flat 40% GST.

No Javed Akhtar to bring Javed Akhtar, defeat Islamists: Taslima NasreenBangladeshi author Taslima Nasreen recalled how poet-lyricist Javed Akhtar once defended her against fundamentalist threats in Mumbai. Now, she noted, the poet himself faced similar hostility in Kolkata with no one to help him. The Bengal government's Urdu Academy cancelled an event after Islamist groups warned it over an invitation to Akhtar.

Trump's false fire at India over Russian arms purchasePresident Donald Trump accused India of buying most of its oil and military products from Russia, and very little from the US. India has actually cut down arms purchases from Russia and is buying more hardware from the US.

Middle class emerges the king as GST 2.0 makes household items cheaperThe GST bonanza will leave more money in the hands of the middle class, which received a substantial tax relief earlier this year after annual income of up to Rs 12 lakh was made tax-free.

I told him...: Putin leaves world guessing over limo ride with PM Modi in ChinaVladimir Putin disclosed that he and Prime Minister Narendra Modi spoke at length during their limousine ride at the SCO summit in China's Tianjin, but kept the conversation's details vague.

Illegal tree felling going on: Top court's notice to Centre, states over floodsThe Supreme Court cautioned that unchecked exploitation of nature is now manifesting in devastating floods, underscoring the urgent need to strike a balance between development and environmental protection.

Vow renewal: Why is a centuries-old Hindu ritual a big global trend now?Vow renewal, now a popular trend around the world, is more like a contemporary take on the ages-old Hindu tradition of Shashtipoorthi. It is being seen as an opportunity to reaffirm commitment, celebrate love, and even fix marriages.

Rainwater has nowhere to go in GurgaonWhy does Gurugram get flooded after just a few hours of rain? The answer is in water's natural property to flow. Gurgaon, as it grew into Gurugram, gobbled up its water bodies and blocked the natural pathways of rainwater sliding down the Aravalli Hills into the catchment area. Gurugram added sector after sector in low-lying areas, including the catchment area of the Sahibi River.

No objectionable content: Court rejects plea against Akshay Kumar's Jolly LLB 3The Allahabad High Court recently dismissed the plea against Akshay Kumar's 'Jolly LLB 3'. The film is slated to hit the big screens on September 19.

Slow Horses 5 trailer: Gary Oldman returns as head of misfits to probe terror plotThe first trailer for actor Gary Oldman's 'Slow Horses Season 5' has been released. The new season delves into London terror plots as Oldman's Jackson Lamb leads his team of misfits.

From the India Today archives (1989) | Long before PM Modi, how Rajiv Gandhi breached the China wallPost-1962 war, for the 26 years leading to Rajiv Gandhi's visit, relations between India and China had been in deep freeze—activated only by border hostilities

Total lunar eclipse on Sunday: These cities will see blood Moon riseUnlike a solar eclipse, which requires protective eyewear, a lunar eclipse is safe to view with the naked eye. As the eclipse peaks, the Moon does not disappear entirely but glows a deep red or coppery colour.

NIRF Ranking 2025: IIT Madras tops for the seventh time. Check category-wise listThe Ministry of Education has announced the NIRF Rankings 2025, with IIT Madras securing the top position in the overall category. Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan released the 10th edition of the rankings at a special event in New Delhi.

Seers cite Dharmasthala row, urge Amit Shah for law to protect saints, templesSeers and community leaders from across India have urged Union Home Minister Amit Shah to enact a law safeguarding saints and religious institutions, citing Dharmasthala, Palghar and Belagavi incidents as alarming examples.

Virus Tirri grows up as ambulance, police van and trainThe humble e-rickshaw, a moving menace, gained prominence after 2010 for last-mile connectivity. Popular as Tirri in west UP, Toto in Bengal and Mayuri in Delhi, the e-rickshaw has morphed into ambulances, police vans and even loading trucks. The caterpillar-to-butterfly story has triggered memories and a meme fest.

sports.headline: Amit Mishra announces retirement from all forms of cricketFormer India wrist spinner Amit Mishra has announced his retirement from all forms of cricket. Mishra last played for India in 2016 and IPL in 2024.

Watch: MS Dhoni returns to US Open, rocks denim-on-denim lookUS Open 2025: Former India captain MS Dhoni was spotted with his friends at the Arthur Ashe Stadium during Novak Djokovic's quarterfinal win over Taylor Fritz. Dhoni rocked a denim-on-denim look for the big-ticket match in New York.

Explained: Watching IPL live just got costlier thanks to new GST rulesCricket fans in India will now have to pay more to watch IPL matches live, after the government raised the GST on premium sporting events from 28% to 40%. A ticket that previously cost Rs 1,000 plus GST, bringing the total to Rs 1,280, will now set fans back Rs 1,400—a jump of Rs 120.

Scottie Scheffler vs Rory McIlroy Set to Captain Golf Channel Games in DecemberWorld No. 1 Scottie Scheffler and No. 2 Rory McIlroy will captain rival teams in the inaugural Golf Channel Games on Dec 17, bringing unique challenges and fast paced formats to fans.

Haider Ali cleared of rape allegations, UK case closed due to lack of evidencePakistan cricketer Haider Ali has been cleared of rape allegations in the United Kingdom, after Greater Manchester Police (GMP) confirmed there was insufficient evidence to pursue the case, Geo News reported.

Asia Cup hockey daily wrap: India held to draw as Korea wind back the clockAsia Cup 2025: Seasoned journalist Sundeep Misra and Alan John join hands to review India's performance against Korea in the first round of Super 4s in Rajgir.

A night of frustration at Asia Cup: The 2-2 draw against KoreaAsia Cup 2025: India were held to a 2-2 draw by Korea, who rolled back the years, playing man-to-man, cutting down on errors, and moving in only when they were convinced of space. India need to step up as they brace for tricky tests in the remainder of the Super 4s stage in Rajgir.

MS Dhoni and I will smoke hookah: Irfan Pathan shuts down troll as old clip explodesAn old 2020 interview of Irfan Pathan has resurfaced on social media, sparking debate over his remarks about MS Dhoni and alleged favouritism in the Indian team. The former all-rounder, however, has clarified his stance, dismissing the chatter as "fan wars" and cheekily shutting down a troll with a "hookah with Dhoni" quip.

Watch: Osaka introduces 'Andre Swagassi' Labubu after reaching US Open semi-finalNaomi Osaka unveiled her fifth Labubu collectible, Andre Swagassi, a playful tribute to tennis legend Andre Agassi, after reaching the US Open semifinals on Wednesday night.

US Open: Spotless Sinner puts friendship aside, decimates Musetti to reach semisJannik Sinner overpowered Lorenzo Musetti in the first all-Italian men's Grand Slam quarter-final at the US Open, extending his remarkable 26-match hardcourt winning streak to set up a semifinal clash with Félix Auger-Aliassime.

India's Yuki Bhambri inches closer to his dream of winning Grand Slam crownIndia's Yuki Bhambri, a former singles specialist, continued his dream run in men's doubles at the US Open. The 33-year-old and his New Zealand partner Michael Venus defeated higher-ranked Rajeev Ram and Nikola Metkic to reach the doubles semi-final in New York on Wednesday, September 3.

A night of frustration at Asia Cup: The 2-2 draw against KoreaAsia Cup 2025: India were held to a 2-2 draw by Korea, who rolled back the years, playing man-to-man, cutting down on errors, and moving in only when they were convinced of space. India need to step up as they brace for tricky tests in the remainder of the Super 4s stage in Rajgir.

MS Dhoni and I will smoke hookah: Irfan Pathan shuts down troll as old clip explodesAn old 2020 interview of Irfan Pathan has resurfaced on social media, sparking debate over his remarks about MS Dhoni and alleged favouritism in the Indian team. The former all-rounder, however, has clarified his stance, dismissing the chatter as "fan wars" and cheekily shutting down a troll with a "hookah with Dhoni" quip.

Watch: Osaka introduces 'Andre Swagassi' Labubu after reaching US Open semi-finalNaomi Osaka unveiled her fifth Labubu collectible, Andre Swagassi, a playful tribute to tennis legend Andre Agassi, after reaching the US Open semifinals on Wednesday night.

US Open: Spotless Sinner puts friendship aside, decimates Musetti to reach semisJannik Sinner overpowered Lorenzo Musetti in the first all-Italian men's Grand Slam quarter-final at the US Open, extending his remarkable 26-match hardcourt winning streak to set up a semifinal clash with Félix Auger-Aliassime.

India's Yuki Bhambri inches closer to his dream of winning Grand Slam crownIndia's Yuki Bhambri, a former singles specialist, continued his dream run in men's doubles at the US Open. The 33-year-old and his New Zealand partner Michael Venus defeated higher-ranked Rajeev Ram and Nikola Metkic to reach the doubles semi-final in New York on Wednesday, September 3.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
